How to do strategy research via backtesters

This is a collection of examples showing how to do strategy research through backtesters, how to plot results,
how to perform strategy parameter optimization.


  • Simple trend following strategy using two moving averages

  • Using financial indicators from ta-lib in strategies

  • Multi-time frame strategy

  • Locating ohlc bars in trading days

  • Persist information in context across trading days

  • Trading two instruments

  • Multiple-bar arrival event

  • Timer in strategies

  • Getting market periods for instruments

  • Combining backtesting reports

  • Walk-forward optimization

  • Iterating over a data source directly

  • Using the plain backtester

  • Strategy with zeromq logger

  • Use external data source in backtesting

  • Strategy mission control

  • starterkit_ipython/

Live trading strategies

This is a collection of live trading strategies. They show how you perform live trading.
They also serve as tests the live trading behavior in different situations.


  • Connecting to CTP

  • Reaching given positions

  • Cancel an order after it has fully executed

  • Cancel an order when it is pending

  • Specify cancellation when placing orders

  • Exit strategy while an order is pending

  • Cancel orders issued by other strategies on the same trading account

  • A high frequency trading example

  • Flat all positions in a trading account.

  • Stand by strategy

  • Mission controller which communicate with strategies.

  • Strategy log printer

  • Reach positions at certain times

  • Position change at every tick

  • Change positions in fast pace with automatic cancellation

  • Place an order and cancel it immediately after

  • Trading server disconnection and re-connection during an order execution.

  • Setup historical ohlc bars in live trading.

  • Basic example on trading relative instrument ids

  • Change position for relative instrument ids

  • Use zeromq-based data producer

  • Synchronize positions from external trading account.

  • Sending received trading data into zmq.
